thread.title: Dow driven lower by IBM, United Technologies
thread.title_full: Dow driven lower by IBM, United Technologies

title: Dow driven lower by IBM, United Technologies
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Tue, Jul 21, 2015, 15:42 BST - UK Markets close in 48 mins. Dow driven lower by IBM, United Technologies AFP â€“ 10 minutes ago View Photo 

The Dow fell in early trade Tuesday following disappointing earnings from IBM (NYSE: IBM - news ) and United Technologies, as the market looked ahead to results from Apple (NasdaqGS: AAPL - news ) later in the day. 
About 30 minutes into trade, the Dow Jones Industrial Average stood at 17,981.85, down 118.56 points (0.66 percent). 
The broad-based S&P 500 slipped 0.40 (0.02 percent) at 2,126.16, while the tech-rich Nasdaq Composite Index gained 9.67 (0.19 percent) to 5,228.53. The Nasdaq has notched record highs the last three sessions. 
IBM slumped 4.9 percent as it reported lower revenues for the 13th straight quarter, with second-quarter sales dropping this time by more than 13 percent to $20.81 billion. 
United Technologies dropped 6.5 percent as it slashed its profit forecast due to economic weakness in China and the drag of the strong dollar, and said second-quarter earnings fell 8.2 percent. 
Verizon Communications (Xetra: 868402 - news ) , another Dow member, lost 3.0 percent after reporting second-quarter net income of $4.4 billion, about 0.7 percent above that of the year-ago period. Revenues of $32.22 billion fell shy of the $32.45 billion projected by analysts. 
Harley-Davidson advanced 3.5 percent as second-quarter earnings and revenues both topped analyst expectations. The motorcycle company confirmed its 2015 targets, including a two to four percent rise in motorcycle deliveries compared with last year. 
Public relations and advertising giant Omnicom fell 1.4 percent as second-quarter net income dropped 2.8 percent to $310 million, due in part to a hit in revenues from the strong dollar. 
Qualcomm (Swiss: QCOM.SW - news ) gained 2.4 percent following a Wall Street Journal report that said the company plans a strategic review that could lead to a breakup of the chipmaker. 
Chesapeake Energy (Other OTC: CHKDP - news ) fell 3.9 percent following an announcement that it will drop its dividend and steer the money into its drilling program. 
Tesla Motors (Xetra: A1CX3T - news ) fell 4.2 percent following a downgrade from UBS (NYSEArca: FBGX - news ) . 
Bond prices were mixed. The yield on the 10-year US Treasury held steady at 2.38 percent, while the 30-year rose to 3.12 percent from 3.10 percent Monday. Bond prices and yields move inversely.
